definition: self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Once throne eyes gaze, age face a dark, remember the human into blacklist.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝眼睛一瞪，老臉一黑，就把人惦記入黑名單了。

sentences.english: Don't let anyone wearing a scowl come closer than a hundred paces.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓任何拉着一副老臉的人接近你。

definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
